we just had 2 afks/trolls (1 running a scripted afk jungle farm path). 

I can guarantee you neither will be punished because "nothing wrong with afking" (quoting volunteers here)

AFK behaviors are picked up automatically by leaver buster and the players are issued a penalty. Unless it was a ranked game, it is unlikely to put them in a low priority queue if it is a rare or one off occurrence for them. You also can't tell if someone has a LPQ from the outside, just like you can't see if people have been chat banned. 

Scripting bans usually take a little while to come into action, since they come out in waves and Riot's detection systems are often a lil bit slower than the ever evolving scripts. That being said, it doesn't mean they won't be punished. It will happen, it will just take time (if they were in fact scripting).
